attractions.name: Nagoya Castle
attractions.description: A majestic 17th-century castle featuring ornate interiors, expansive gardens, and seasonal cherry blossoms.

attractions.name: Atsuta Jingu Shrine
attractions.description: One of Japan’s oldest Shinto shrines, housing the sacred Kusanagi no Tsurugi sword.

attractions.name: Toyota Commemorative Museum of Industry and Technology
attractions.description: Explore the evolution of Toyota from textile machinery to automotive innovation.

attractions.name: SCMaglev and Railway Park
attractions.description: A hands-on museum showcasing Japan’s high-speed trains, including the maglev.

attractions.name: Higashiyama Zoo and Botanical Gardens
attractions.description: A combined zoo and botanical garden featuring over 450 species and diverse plant collections.

attractions.name: Osu Shopping District
attractions.description: A vibrant area blending traditional and modern shops, eateries, and arcades.

attractions.name: Midland Square
attractions.description: Nagoya's tallest skyscraper with luxury shopping, dining, and the Sky Promenade offering city views.

attractions.name: Port of Nagoya Public Aquarium
attractions.description: Features marine life from around the world, including dolphins and a large whale tank.

attractions.name: LEGOLAND Japan
attractions.description: A family-friendly amusement park with LEGO-themed rides and attractions.

attractions.name: Nagoya TV Tower
attractions.description: Japan's oldest TV tower with panoramic views from its Sky Deck and Sky Balcony.
